snippet: After years of political and legal threats that kept President Obama’s health care law in a state of uncertainty, his re-election all but assures it will survive. The next hurdle is making it work.
abstract: Pres Obama's re-election all but guarantees that his health care law will survive, after nearly three years of legal and political threats that kept the legislation in uncertainty; election came just 10 days before critical deadline for states in carrying out the law, and many that were waiting for outcome must now hustle to comply.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: After years of political and legal threats that kept President Obama’s health care law in a state of uncertainty, his re-election all but assures it will survive. The next hurdle is making it work.

headline.seo: States Rush to Meet Tight Health Care Deadlines
headline.main: With Obama Re-elected, States Scramble Over Health Law
headline.print_headline: Election Over, States Race On Deadlines In Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
